def command( callback: Union[Callable[..., Awaitable[Any]], type[crescent.ClassCommandProto], NoneType] = None, /, *, guild: Union[hikari.snowflakes.Snowflake, int, NoneType] = None, name: str | crescent.LocaleBuilder | None = None, description: str | crescent.LocaleBuilder | None = None, default_member_permissions: hikari.undefined.UndefinedType | int | hikari.permissions.Permissions = UNDEFINED, dm_enabled: bool = True, nsfw: bool | None = None) -> Union[crescent.internal.includable.Includable[crescent.internal.app_command.AppCommandMeta], Callable[[Union[Callable[..., Awaitable[Any]], type[crescent.ClassCommandProto]]], crescent.internal.includable.Includable[crescent.internal.app_command.AppCommandMeta]]]: 
 70def command(
 71    callback: CommandCallbackT | type[ClassCommandProto] | None = None,
 72    /,
 73    *,
 74    guild: Snowflakeish | None = None,
 75    name: str | LocaleBuilder | None = None,
 76    description: str | LocaleBuilder | None = None,
 77    default_member_permissions: UndefinedType | int | Permissions = UNDEFINED,
 78    dm_enabled: bool = True,
 79    nsfw: bool | None = None,
 80) -> (
 81    Includable[AppCommandMeta]
 82    | Callable[[CommandCallbackT | type[ClassCommandProto]], Includable[AppCommandMeta]]
 83):
 84    if not callback:
 85        return partial(
 86            command,
 87            guild=guild,
 88            name=name,
 89            description=description,
 90            default_member_permissions=default_member_permissions,
 91            dm_enabled=dm_enabled,
 92            nsfw=nsfw,
 93        )
 94
 95    autocomplete: dict[str, AutocompleteCallbackT] = {}
 96    options: list[CommandOption] = []
 97
 98    if isclass(callback):
 99        # If callback is a class it must be `type[ClassCommandProto]` because of the function
100        # signature.
101        callback = cast("type[ClassCommandProto]", callback)
102
103        name_map: dict[str, str] = {}
104        defaults: dict[str, Any] = {}
105
106        for n, v in callback.__dict__.items():
107            if not isinstance(v, ClassCommandOption):
108                continue
109
110            generated = v._gen_option(n)
111            options.append(generated)
112
113            if v.autocomplete:
114                autocomplete[generated.name] = v.autocomplete
115
116            if generated.name != n:
117                name_map[generated.name] = n
118
119            defaults[generated.name] = v.default
120
121        callback_func = _class_command_callback(callback, defaults, name_map)
122
123    elif isfunction(callback):
124        callback_func = callback
125
126        for param in sigparse(callback_func).parameters:
127            option = gen_command_option(param)
128            if not option:
129                continue
130
131            options.append(option)
132
133            if autocomplete_func := get_autocomplete_func(param):
134                autocomplete[option.name] = autocomplete_func
135
136    else:
137        raise NotImplementedError("This function only works with classes and functions")
138
139    return register_command(
140        callback=callback_func,
141        owner=callback,
142        command_type=CommandType.SLASH,
143        name=name or callback.__name__,
144        guild=guild,
145        description=description or "No Description",
146        options=options,
147        default_member_permissions=default_member_permissions,
148        dm_enabled=dm_enabled,
149        autocomplete=autocomplete,
150        nsfw=nsfw,
151    )
def user_command( callback: Optional[Callable[[Any, hikari.users.User], Awaitable[NoneType]]] = None, /, *, guild: Union[hikari.snowflakes.Snowflake, int, NoneType] = None, name: str | None = None, default_member_permissions: hikari.undefined.UndefinedType | int | hikari.permissions.Permissions = UNDEFINED, dm_enabled: bool = True, nsfw: bool | None = None) -> Union[Callable[[Callable[[Any, hikari.users.User], Awaitable[NoneType]]], crescent.internal.includable.Includable[crescent.internal.app_command.AppCommandMeta]], crescent.internal.includable.Includable[crescent.internal.app_command.AppCommandMeta]]:

184    *,

193            user_command,
194            guild=guild,
195            name=name,
196            default_member_permissions=default_member_permissions,
197            dm_enabled=dm_enabled,
198            nsfw=nsfw,
199        )

205        name=name or callback.__name__,

def option( option_type: Union[type[Union[str, bool, int, float, hikari.channels.PartialChannel, hikari.guilds.Role, hikari.users.User, crescent.Mentionable, hikari.messages.Attachment]], Sequence[type[hikari.channels.PartialChannel]]], description: str | crescent.LocaleBuilder = 'No Description', *, default: Union[Any, hikari.undefined.UndefinedType] = UNDEFINED, choices: Optional[Sequence[tuple[str, str | int | float]]] = None, min_value: int | float | None = None, max_value: int | float | None = None, min_length: int | None = None, max_length: int | None = None, name: str | crescent.LocaleBuilder | None = None, autocomplete: Optional[Callable[[Any, hikari.interactions.command_interactions.AutocompleteInteractionOption], Awaitable[Sequence[hikari.commands.CommandChoice]]]] = None) -> crescent.ClassCommandOption[typing.Any]: 
370def option(
371    option_type: type[OptionTypesT] | Sequence[type[PartialChannel]],
372    description: str | LocaleBuilder = "No Description",
373    *,
374    default: UndefinedOr[Any] = UNDEFINED,
375    choices: Sequence[tuple[str, str | int | float]] | None = None,
376    min_value: int | float | None = None,
377    max_value: int | float | None = None,
378    min_length: int | None = None,
379    max_length: int | None = None,
380    name: str | LocaleBuilder | None = None,
381    autocomplete: AutocompleteCallbackT | None = None,
382) -> ClassCommandOption[Any]:
383    _option_type: type[OptionTypesT]
384    if (
385        isinstance(option_type, type)
386        and issubclass(option_type, PartialChannel)
387        and option_type is not PartialChannel
388    ):
389        option_type = cast("type[VALID_CHANNEL_TYPES]", option_type)
390        channel_types = get_channel_types(option_type)
391        _option_type = PartialChannel
392    elif isinstance(option_type, Sequence):
393        channel_types = get_channel_types(*option_type)
394        _option_type = PartialChannel
395    else:
396        _option_type = option_type
397        channel_types = None
398
399    return ClassCommandOption(
400        type=OPTIONS_TYPE_MAP[_option_type],
401        description=description,
402        default=default,
403        choices=[CommandChoice(name=n, value=v) for n, v in choices] if choices else None,
404        channel_types=list(channel_types) if channel_types else None,
405        min_value=min_value,
406        max_value=max_value,
407        min_length=min_length,
408        max_length=max_length,
409        name=name,
410        autocomplete=autocomplete,
411    )
class hook: 
22class hook:
23    def __init__(self, *callbacks: HookCallbackT, after: bool = False):
24        self.callbacks = callbacks
25        self.after = after
26
27    def __call__(self, command: Includable[AppCommandMeta]) -> Includable[AppCommandMeta]:
28        for callback in self.callbacks:
29            if not iscoroutinefunction(callback):
30                raise ValueError(f"Function `{callback.__name__}` must be async.")
31        command.metadata.add_hooks(self.callbacks, prepend=True, after=self.after)
32
33        return command
hook( *callbacks: Callable[[Any], Awaitable[Optional[crescent.HookResult]]], after: bool = False) 
23    def __init__(self, *callbacks: HookCallbackT, after: bool = False):
24        self.callbacks = callbacks
25        self.after = after

@dataclass
class Group: 
35@dataclass
36class Group:
37    name: str | LocaleBuilder
38    description: str | LocaleBuilder | None = None
39    hooks: list[HookCallbackT] | None = None
40    after_hooks: list[HookCallbackT] | None = None
41
42    default_member_permissions: UndefinedType | int | Permissions = UNDEFINED
43    dm_enabled: bool = True
44
45    def sub_group(
46        self,
47        name: str | LocaleBuilder,
48        description: str | LocaleBuilder | None = None,
49        hooks: list[HookCallbackT] | None = None,
50        after_hooks: list[HookCallbackT] | None = None,
51    ) -> SubGroup:
52        return SubGroup(
53            name=name, parent=self, description=description, hooks=hooks, after_hooks=after_hooks
54        )
55
56    def child(self, includable: Includable[AppCommandMeta]) -> Includable[AppCommandMeta]:
57        _check_permissions(includable)
58
59        includable.metadata.group = self
60
61        add_hooks(self, includable)
62
63        return includable
Group( name: str | crescent.LocaleBuilder, description: str | crescent.LocaleBuilder | None = None, hooks: list[typing.Callable[[typing.Any], typing.Awaitable[typing.Optional[crescent.HookResult]]]] | None = None, after_hooks: list[typing.Callable[[typing.Any], typing.Awaitable[typing.Optional[crescent.HookResult]]]] | None = None, default_member_permissions: hikari.undefined.UndefinedType | int | hikari.permissions.Permissions = UNDEFINED, dm_enabled: bool = True)
def sub_group( self, name: str | crescent.LocaleBuilder, description: str | crescent.LocaleBuilder | None = None, hooks: list[typing.Callable[[typing.Any], typing.Awaitable[typing.Optional[crescent.HookResult]]]] | None = None, after_hooks: list[typing.Callable[[typing.Any], typing.Awaitable[typing.Optional[crescent.HookResult]]]] | None = None) -> crescent.SubGroup:

def child( self, includable: crescent.internal.includable.Includable[crescent.internal.app_command.AppCommandMeta]) -> crescent.internal.includable.Includable[crescent.internal.app_command.AppCommandMeta]:

@dataclass
class SubGroup: 
66@dataclass
67class SubGroup:
68    name: str | LocaleBuilder
69    parent: Group
70    description: str | LocaleBuilder | None = None
71    hooks: list[HookCallbackT] | None = None
72    after_hooks: list[HookCallbackT] | None = None
73
74    def child(self, includable: Includable[AppCommandMeta]) -> Includable[AppCommandMeta]:
75        _check_permissions(includable)
76
77        includable.metadata.group = self.parent
78        includable.metadata.sub_group = self
79
80        add_hooks(self, includable)
81        add_hooks(self.parent, includable)
82
83        return includable
SubGroup( name: str | crescent.LocaleBuilder, parent: crescent.Group, description: str | crescent.LocaleBuilder | None = None, hooks: list[typing.Callable[[typing.Any], typing.Awaitable[typing.Optional[crescent.HookResult]]]] | None = None, after_hooks: list[typing.Callable[[typing.Any], typing.Awaitable[typing.Optional[crescent.HookResult]]]] | None = None)
def child( self, includable: crescent.internal.includable.Includable[crescent.internal.app_command.AppCommandMeta]) -> crescent.internal.includable.Includable[crescent.internal.app_command.AppCommandMeta]: 
74    def child(self, includable: Includable[AppCommandMeta]) -> Includable[AppCommandMeta]:
75        _check_permissions(includable)
76
77        includable.metadata.group = self.parent
78        includable.metadata.sub_group = self
79
80        add_hooks(self, includable)
81        add_hooks(self.parent, includable)
82
83        return includable
class Client: 
 59class Client:
 60    def __init__(
 61        self,
 62        app: RESTTraits | GatewayTraits,
 63        model: Any = None,
 64        *,
 65        tracked_guilds: Sequence[Snowflakeish] | None = None,
 66        default_guild: Snowflakeish | None = None,
 67        update_commands: bool = True,
 68        allow_unknown_interactions: bool = False,
 69        command_hooks: list[HookCallbackT] | None = None,
 70        command_after_hooks: list[HookCallbackT] | None = None,
 71    ):
 72        """
 73        Args:
 74            app:
 75                The hikari bot instance.
 76            tracked_guilds:
 77                The guilds to compare posted commands to. Commands will not be
 78                automatically removed from guilds that aren't in this list. This should
 79                be kept to as little guilds as possible to prevent rate limits.
 80            default_guild:
 81                The guild to post application commands to by default. If this is None,
 82                slash commands will be posted globally.
 83            update_commands:
 84                If `True` or not specified, update commands when the bot starts.
 85                Only works for gateway-based bots.
 86            command_hooks:
 87                List of hooks to run before all commands.
 88            command_after_hooks:
 89                List of hooks to run after all commands.
 90        """
 91        self.app = app
 92        self.model = model
 93
 94        if update_commands:
 95            self._add_startup_callback(self.post_commands)
 96        self._add_startup_callback(self._on_start)
 97
 98        if tracked_guilds is None:
 99            tracked_guilds = ()
100
101        if default_guild and default_guild not in tracked_guilds:
102            tracked_guilds = tuple(chain(tracked_guilds, (default_guild,)))
103
104        self.allow_unknown_interactions = allow_unknown_interactions
105        self.update_commands = update_commands
106
107        self.command_hooks = command_hooks
108        self.command_after_hooks = command_after_hooks
109
110        self._command_handler: CommandHandler = CommandHandler(self, tracked_guilds)
111
112        self._command_error_handler: ErrorHandler[
113            CommandErrorHandlerCallbackT[Any]
114        ] = ErrorHandler()
115        self._event_error_handler: ErrorHandler[EventErrorHandlerCallbackT[Any]] = ErrorHandler()
116        self._autocomplete_error_handler: ErrorHandler[
117            AutocompleteErrorHandlerCallbackT[Any]
118        ] = ErrorHandler()
119
120        self.default_guild: Snowflakeish | None = default_guild
121
122        self._plugins = PluginManager(self)
123
124        self._started = False
125
126        if isinstance(app, GatewayTraits):
127            app.event_manager.subscribe(InteractionCreateEvent, self.on_interaction_event)
128            return
129        app.interaction_server.set_listener(
130            CommandInteraction,  # pyright: ignore
131            self.on_rest_interaction,  # type: ignore
132        )
133        app.interaction_server.set_listener(
134            AutocompleteInteraction,  # type: ignore
135            self.on_rest_interaction,  # type: ignore
136        )
137
138    async def on_rest_interaction(
139        self, interaction: PartialInteraction
140    ) -> InteractionResponseBuilder:
141        future: Future[InteractionResponseBuilder] = get_running_loop().create_future()
142        create_task(handle_resp(self, interaction, future))
143        return await future
144
145    async def on_interaction_event(self, event: InteractionCreateEvent) -> None:
146        await handle_resp(self, event.interaction, None)
147
148    def post_commands(self) -> Coroutine[Any, Any, None]:
149        return self._command_handler.register_commands()
150
151    @overload
152    def include(self, command: INCLUDABLE) -> INCLUDABLE:
153        ...
154
155    @overload
156    def include(self, command: None = ...) -> Callable[[INCLUDABLE], INCLUDABLE]:
157        ...
158
159    def include(
160        self, command: INCLUDABLE | None = None
161    ) -> INCLUDABLE | Callable[[INCLUDABLE], INCLUDABLE]:
162        if command is None:
163            return self.include
164
165        add_hooks(self, command)
166
167        command.register_to_client(self)
168
169        return command
170
171    @property
172    def plugins(self) -> PluginManager:
173        return self._plugins
174
175    @property
176    def commands(self) -> CommandHandler:
177        return self._command_handler
178
179    async def on_crescent_command_error(
180        self, exc: Exception, ctx: Context, was_handled: bool
181    ) -> None:
182        if was_handled:
183            return
184        with suppress(Exception):
185            await ctx.respond("An unexpected error occurred.", ephemeral=True)
186        print(f"Unhandled exception occurred in the command {ctx.command}:")
187        print_exception(exc.__class__, exc, exc.__traceback__)
188
189    async def on_crescent_event_error(
190        self, exc: Exception, event: hk_Event, was_handled: bool
191    ) -> None:
192        if was_handled:
193            return
194        print(f"Unhandled exception occurred for {type(event)}:")
195        print_exception(exc.__class__, exc, exc.__traceback__)
196
197    async def on_crescent_autocomplete_error(
198        self,
199        exc: Exception,
200        ctx: AutocompleteContext,
201        option: AutocompleteInteractionOption,
202        was_handled: bool,
203    ) -> None:
204        if was_handled:
205            return
206        print(
207            f"Unhandled exception occurred in the autocomplete interaction for {ctx.command}"
208            f" (option: {option.name}):"
209        )
210        print_exception(exc.__class__, exc, exc.__traceback__)
211
212    def _run_future(self, callback: Coroutine[Any, Any, Any]) -> None:
213        if self._started:
214            get_running_loop().create_task(callback)
215        else:
216            self._add_startup_callback(lambda: callback)
217
218    async def _on_start(self) -> None:
219        self._started = True
220
221    def _add_startup_callback(
222        self, callback: Callable[[], Awaitable[None]]
223    ) -> Callable[[], None] | None:
224        async def on_start(_: Any) -> None:
225            await callback()
226
227        if isinstance(self.app, GatewayTraits):
228            self.app.event_manager.subscribe(StartedEvent, on_start)
229            return partial(self.app.event_manager.unsubscribe, StartedEvent, on_start)
230        elif isinstance(self.app, RESTBotAware):
231            self.app.add_startup_callback(on_start)
232            return partial(self.app.remove_startup_callback, on_start)
233        return None
Client( app: crescent.RESTTraits | crescent.GatewayTraits, model: Any = None, *, tracked_guilds: Optional[Sequence[Union[hikari.snowflakes.Snowflake, int]]] = None, default_guild: Union[hikari.snowflakes.Snowflake, int, NoneType] = None, update_commands: bool = True, allow_unknown_interactions: bool = False, command_hooks: list[typing.Callable[[typing.Any], typing.Awaitable[typing.Optional[crescent.HookResult]]]] | None = None, command_after_hooks: list[typing.Callable[[typing.Any], typing.Awaitable[typing.Optional[crescent.HookResult]]]] | None = None) 
 60    def __init__(
 61        self,
 62        app: RESTTraits | GatewayTraits,
 63        model: Any = None,
 64        *,
 65        tracked_guilds: Sequence[Snowflakeish] | None = None,
 66        default_guild: Snowflakeish | None = None,
 67        update_commands: bool = True,
 68        allow_unknown_interactions: bool = False,
 69        command_hooks: list[HookCallbackT] | None = None,
 70        command_after_hooks: list[HookCallbackT] | None = None,
 71    ):
 72        """
 73        Args:
 74            app:
 75                The hikari bot instance.
 76            tracked_guilds:
 77                The guilds to compare posted commands to. Commands will not be
 78                automatically removed from guilds that aren't in this list. This should
 79                be kept to as little guilds as possible to prevent rate limits.
 80            default_guild:
 81                The guild to post application commands to by default. If this is None,
 82                slash commands will be posted globally.
 83            update_commands:
 84                If `True` or not specified, update commands when the bot starts.
 85                Only works for gateway-based bots.
 86            command_hooks:
 87                List of hooks to run before all commands.
 88            command_after_hooks:
 89                List of hooks to run after all commands.
 90        """
 91        self.app = app
 92        self.model = model
 93
 94        if update_commands:
 95            self._add_startup_callback(self.post_commands)
 96        self._add_startup_callback(self._on_start)
 97
 98        if tracked_guilds is None:
 99            tracked_guilds = ()
100
101        if default_guild and default_guild not in tracked_guilds:
102            tracked_guilds = tuple(chain(tracked_guilds, (default_guild,)))
103
104        self.allow_unknown_interactions = allow_unknown_interactions
105        self.update_commands = update_commands
106
107        self.command_hooks = command_hooks
108        self.command_after_hooks = command_after_hooks
109
110        self._command_handler: CommandHandler = CommandHandler(self, tracked_guilds)
111
112        self._command_error_handler: ErrorHandler[
113            CommandErrorHandlerCallbackT[Any]
114        ] = ErrorHandler()
115        self._event_error_handler: ErrorHandler[EventErrorHandlerCallbackT[Any]] = ErrorHandler()
116        self._autocomplete_error_handler: ErrorHandler[
117            AutocompleteErrorHandlerCallbackT[Any]
118        ] = ErrorHandler()
119
120        self.default_guild: Snowflakeish | None = default_guild
121
122        self._plugins = PluginManager(self)
123
124        self._started = False
125
126        if isinstance(app, GatewayTraits):
127            app.event_manager.subscribe(InteractionCreateEvent, self.on_interaction_event)
128            return
129        app.interaction_server.set_listener(
130            CommandInteraction,  # pyright: ignore
131            self.on_rest_interaction,  # type: ignore
132        )
133        app.interaction_server.set_listener(
134            AutocompleteInteraction,  # type: ignore
135            self.on_rest_interaction,  # type: ignore
136        )
Arguments:
  • app: The hikari bot instance.
  • tracked_guilds: The guilds to compare posted commands to. Commands will not be automatically removed from guilds that aren't in this list. This should be kept to as little guilds as possible to prevent rate limits.
  • default_guild: The guild to post application commands to by default. If this is None, slash commands will be posted globally.
  • update_commands: If True or not specified, update commands when the bot starts. Only works for gateway-based bots.
  • command_hooks: List of hooks to run before all commands.
  • command_after_hooks: List of hooks to run after all commands.
async def on_rest_interaction( self, interaction: hikari.interactions.base_interactions.PartialInteraction) -> hikari.api.special_endpoints.InteractionResponseBuilder: 
138    async def on_rest_interaction(
139        self, interaction: PartialInteraction
140    ) -> InteractionResponseBuilder:
141        future: Future[InteractionResponseBuilder] = get_running_loop().create_future()
142        create_task(handle_resp(self, interaction, future))
143        return await future
async def on_interaction_event( self, event: hikari.events.interaction_events.InteractionCreateEvent) -> None: 
145    async def on_interaction_event(self, event: InteractionCreateEvent) -> None:
146        await handle_resp(self, event.interaction, None)
def post_commands(self) -> Coroutine[Any, Any, NoneType]: 
148    def post_commands(self) -> Coroutine[Any, Any, None]:
149        return self._command_handler.register_commands()
def include( self, command: Optional[~INCLUDABLE] = None) -> Union[~INCLUDABLE, Callable[[~INCLUDABLE], ~INCLUDABLE]]: 
159    def include(
160        self, command: INCLUDABLE | None = None
161    ) -> INCLUDABLE | Callable[[INCLUDABLE], INCLUDABLE]:
162        if command is None:
163            return self.include
164
165        add_hooks(self, command)
166
167        command.register_to_client(self)
168
169        return command

GatewayTraits(*args, **kwargs) 
1431def _no_init_or_replace_init(self, *args, **kwargs):
1432    cls = type(self)
1433
1434    if cls._is_protocol:
1435        raise TypeError('Protocols cannot be instantiated')
1436
1437    # Already using a custom `__init__`. No need to calculate correct
1438    # `__init__` to call. This can lead to RecursionError. See bpo-45121.
1439    if cls.__init__ is not _no_init_or_replace_init:
1440        return
1441
1442    # Initially, `__init__` of a protocol subclass is set to `_no_init_or_replace_init`.
1443    # The first instantiation of the subclass will call `_no_init_or_replace_init` which
1444    # searches for a proper new `__init__` in the MRO. The new `__init__`
1445    # replaces the subclass' old `__init__` (ie `_no_init_or_replace_init`). Subsequent
1446    # instantiation of the protocol subclass will thus use the new
1447    # `__init__` and no longer call `_no_init_or_replace_init`.
1448    for base in cls.__mro__:
1449        init = base.__dict__.get('__init__', _no_init_or_replace_init)
1450        if init is not _no_init_or_replace_init:
1451            cls.__init__ = init
1452            break
1453    else:
1454        # should not happen
1455        cls.__init__ = object.__init__
1456
1457    cls.__init__(self, *args, **kwargs)
Inherited Members

event_manager

rest
hikari.traits.EntityFactoryAware
entity_factory

http_settings
proxy_settings

1440        return
1441
1442    # Initially, `__init__` of a protocol subclass is set to `_no_init_or_replace_init`.
1443    # The first instantiation of the subclass will call `_no_init_or_replace_init` which
1444    # searches for a proper new `__init__` in the MRO. The new `__init__`
1445    # replaces the subclass' old `__init__` (ie `_no_init_or_replace_init`). Subsequent
1446    # instantiation of the protocol subclass will thus use the new

class Context(crescent.context.base_context.BaseContext): 
 34class Context(BaseContext):
 35    """Represents the context for command interactions"""
 36
 37    interaction: CommandInteraction
 38
 39    @property
 40    def channel(self) -> GuildChannel | None:
 41        if isinstance(self.app, CacheAware):
 42            return self.app.cache.get_guild_channel(self.channel_id)
 43        return None
 44
 45    @property
 46    def guild(self) -> Guild | None:
 47        if isinstance(self.app, CacheAware):
 48            return map_or(self.guild_id, self.app.cache.get_available_guild)
 49        return None
 50
 51    async def defer(self, ephemeral: bool = False) -> None:
 52        """
 53        Defer this interaction response, allowing you to respond within the next 15
 54        minutes.
 55        """
 56
 57        if future := self._unset_future:
 58            future.set_result(self.interaction.build_deferred_response())
 59        else:
 60            await self.app.rest.create_interaction_response(
 61                interaction=self.id,
 62                token=self.token,
 63                flags=MessageFlag.EPHEMERAL if ephemeral else UNDEFINED,
 64                response_type=ResponseType.DEFERRED_MESSAGE_CREATE,
 65            )
 66        self._has_deferred_response = True
 67
 68    @overload
 69    async def respond(
 70        self,
 71        content: UndefinedOr[Any] = UNDEFINED,
 72        *,
 73        ensure_message: Literal[True],
 74        ephemeral: bool = False,
 75        flags: int | MessageFlag | UndefinedType = UNDEFINED,
 76        tts: UndefinedOr[bool] = UNDEFINED,
 77        attachment: UndefinedOr[Resourceish] = UNDEFINED,
 78        attachments: UndefinedOr[Sequence[Resourceish]] = UNDEFINED,
 79        component: UndefinedOr[ComponentBuilder] = UNDEFINED,
 80        components: UndefinedOr[Sequence[ComponentBuilder]] = UNDEFINED,
 81        embed: UndefinedOr[Embed] = UNDEFINED,
 82        embeds: UndefinedOr[Sequence[Embed]] = UNDEFINED,
 83        mentions_everyone: UndefinedOr[bool] = UNDEFINED,
 84        user_mentions: UndefinedOr[SnowflakeishSequence[PartialUser] | bool] = UNDEFINED,
 85        role_mentions: UndefinedOr[SnowflakeishSequence[PartialRole] | bool] = UNDEFINED,
 86    ) -> Message:
 87        ...
 88
 89    @overload
 90    async def respond(
 91        self,
 92        content: UndefinedOr[Any] = UNDEFINED,
 93        *,
 94        ephemeral: bool = False,
 95        flags: int | MessageFlag | UndefinedType = UNDEFINED,
 96        tts: UndefinedOr[bool] = UNDEFINED,
 97        attachment: UndefinedOr[Resourceish] = UNDEFINED,
 98        attachments: UndefinedOr[Sequence[Resourceish]] = UNDEFINED,
 99        component: UndefinedOr[ComponentBuilder] = UNDEFINED,
100        components: UndefinedOr[Sequence[ComponentBuilder]] = UNDEFINED,
101        embed: UndefinedOr[Embed] = UNDEFINED,
102        embeds: UndefinedOr[Sequence[Embed]] = UNDEFINED,
103        mentions_everyone: UndefinedOr[bool] = UNDEFINED,
104        user_mentions: UndefinedOr[SnowflakeishSequence[PartialUser] | bool] = UNDEFINED,
105        role_mentions: UndefinedOr[SnowflakeishSequence[PartialRole] | bool] = UNDEFINED,
106        ensure_message: Literal[False] = ...,
107    ) -> Message | None:
108        ...
109
110    async def respond(
111        self,
112        content: UndefinedOr[Any] = UNDEFINED,
113        *,
114        ephemeral: bool = False,
115        flags: int | MessageFlag | UndefinedType = UNDEFINED,
116        tts: UndefinedOr[bool] = UNDEFINED,
117        attachment: UndefinedOr[Resourceish] = UNDEFINED,
118        attachments: UndefinedOr[Sequence[Resourceish]] = UNDEFINED,
119        component: UndefinedOr[ComponentBuilder] = UNDEFINED,
120        components: UndefinedOr[Sequence[ComponentBuilder]] = UNDEFINED,
121        embed: UndefinedOr[Embed] = UNDEFINED,
122        embeds: UndefinedOr[Sequence[Embed]] = UNDEFINED,
123        mentions_everyone: UndefinedOr[bool] = UNDEFINED,
124        user_mentions: UndefinedOr[SnowflakeishSequence[PartialUser] | bool] = UNDEFINED,
125        role_mentions: UndefinedOr[SnowflakeishSequence[PartialRole] | bool] = UNDEFINED,
126        ensure_message: bool = False,
127    ) -> Message | None:
128        if ephemeral:
129            if flags is UNDEFINED:
130                flags = MessageFlag.EPHEMERAL
131            else:
132                flags |= MessageFlag.EPHEMERAL
133
134        kwargs: dict[str, Any] = dict(
135            content=content,
136            attachment=attachment,
137            attachments=attachments,
138            component=component,
139            components=components,
140            embed=embed,
141            embeds=embeds,
142            mentions_everyone=mentions_everyone,
143            user_mentions=user_mentions,
144            role_mentions=role_mentions,
145        )
146
147        if not (self._has_deferred_response or self._has_created_message):
148            if future := self._unset_future:
149                resp = (
150                    self.interaction.build_response()
151                    .set_content(content)
152                    .set_user_mentions(user_mentions)
153                    .set_role_mentions(role_mentions)
154                    .set_mentions_everyone(mentions_everyone)
155                    .set_flags(flags)
156                    .set_tts(tts)
157                )
158                if attachments:
159                    for a in attachments:
160                        resp = resp.add_attachment(a)
161                if attachment:
162                    resp = resp.add_attachment(attachment)
163                if components:
164                    for c in components:
165                        resp = resp.add_component(c)
166                if component:
167                    resp = resp.add_component(component)
168                if embeds:
169                    for e in embeds:
170                        resp = resp.add_embed(e)
171                if embed:
172                    resp = resp.add_embed(embed)
173
174                future.set_result(resp)
175            else:
176                await self.app.rest.create_interaction_response(
177                    **kwargs,
178                    tts=tts,
179                    flags=flags,
180                    interaction=self.id,
181                    token=self.token,
182                    response_type=ResponseType.MESSAGE_CREATE,
183                )
184
185            self._has_created_message = True
186
187            if not ensure_message:
188                return None
189
190            return await self.app.rest.fetch_interaction_response(self.application_id, self.token)
191
192        if self._has_deferred_response and not self._has_created_message:
193            res = await self.edit(**kwargs)
194            self._has_created_message = True
195            return res
196
197        return await self.followup(**kwargs)
198
199    async def edit(
200        self,
201        content: UndefinedNoneOr[Any] = UNDEFINED,
202        *,
203        attachment: UndefinedNoneOr[Resourceish | Attachment] = UNDEFINED,
204        attachments: UndefinedNoneOr[Sequence[Resourceish | Attachment]] = UNDEFINED,
205        component: UndefinedNoneOr[ComponentBuilder] = UNDEFINED,
206        components: UndefinedNoneOr[Sequence[ComponentBuilder]] = UNDEFINED,
207        embed: UndefinedNoneOr[Embed] = UNDEFINED,
208        embeds: UndefinedNoneOr[Sequence[Embed]] = UNDEFINED,
209        mentions_everyone: UndefinedOr[bool] = UNDEFINED,
210        user_mentions: UndefinedOr[SnowflakeishSequence[PartialUser] | bool] = UNDEFINED,
211        role_mentions: UndefinedOr[SnowflakeishSequence[PartialRole] | bool] = UNDEFINED,
212    ) -> Message:
213        return await self.app.rest.edit_interaction_response(
214            application=self.application_id,
215            token=self.token,
216            content=content,
217            attachment=attachment,
218            attachments=attachments,
219            component=component,
220            components=components,
221            embed=embed,
222            embeds=embeds,
223            mentions_everyone=mentions_everyone,
224            user_mentions=user_mentions,
225            role_mentions=role_mentions,
226        )
227
228    async def followup(
229        self,
230        content: UndefinedNoneOr[Any] = UNDEFINED,
231        *,
232        attachment: UndefinedOr[Resourceish] = UNDEFINED,
233        attachments: UndefinedOr[Sequence[Resourceish]] = UNDEFINED,
234        component: UndefinedOr[ComponentBuilder] = UNDEFINED,
235        components: UndefinedOr[Sequence[ComponentBuilder]] = UNDEFINED,
236        embed: UndefinedOr[Embed] = UNDEFINED,
237        embeds: UndefinedOr[Sequence[Embed]] = UNDEFINED,
238        mentions_everyone: UndefinedOr[bool] = UNDEFINED,
239        user_mentions: UndefinedOr[SnowflakeishSequence[PartialUser] | bool] = UNDEFINED,
240        role_mentions: UndefinedOr[SnowflakeishSequence[PartialRole] | bool] = UNDEFINED,
241    ) -> Message:
242        return await self.app.rest.execute_webhook(
243            webhook=self.application_id,
244            token=self.token,
245            content=content,
246            attachment=attachment,
247            attachments=attachments,
248            component=component,
249            components=components,
250            embed=embed,
251            embeds=embeds,
252            mentions_everyone=mentions_everyone,
253            user_mentions=user_mentions,
254            role_mentions=role_mentions,
255        )
256
257    async def delete(self) -> None:
258        await self.app.rest.delete_interaction_response(
259            application=self.application_id, token=self.token
260        )

async def respond( self, content: Union[Any, hikari.undefined.UndefinedType] = UNDEFINED, *, ephemeral: bool = False, flags: int | hikari.messages.MessageFlag | hikari.undefined.UndefinedType = UNDEFINED, tts: Union[bool, hikari.undefined.UndefinedType] = UNDEFINED, attachment: 'UndefinedOr[Resourceish]' = UNDEFINED, attachments: 'UndefinedOr[Sequence[Resourceish]]' = UNDEFINED, component: Union[hikari.api.special_endpoints.ComponentBuilder, hikari.undefined.UndefinedType] = UNDEFINED, components: Union[Sequence[hikari.api.special_endpoints.ComponentBuilder], hikari.undefined.UndefinedType] = UNDEFINED, embed: Union[hikari.embeds.Embed, hikari.undefined.UndefinedType] = UNDEFINED, embeds: Union[Sequence[hikari.embeds.Embed], hikari.undefined.UndefinedType] = UNDEFINED, mentions_everyone: Union[bool, hikari.undefined.UndefinedType] = UNDEFINED, user_mentions: Union[Sequence[Union[hikari.users.PartialUser, hikari.snowflakes.Snowflake, int]], bool, hikari.undefined.UndefinedType] = UNDEFINED, role_mentions: Union[Sequence[Union[hikari.guilds.PartialRole, hikari.snowflakes.Snowflake, int]], bool, hikari.undefined.UndefinedType] = UNDEFINED, ensure_message: bool = False) -> hikari.messages.Message | None: 
110    async def respond(
111        self,
112        content: UndefinedOr[Any] = UNDEFINED,
113        *,
114        ephemeral: bool = False,
115        flags: int | MessageFlag | UndefinedType = UNDEFINED,
116        tts: UndefinedOr[bool] = UNDEFINED,
117        attachment: UndefinedOr[Resourceish] = UNDEFINED,
118        attachments: UndefinedOr[Sequence[Resourceish]] = UNDEFINED,
119        component: UndefinedOr[ComponentBuilder] = UNDEFINED,
120        components: UndefinedOr[Sequence[ComponentBuilder]] = UNDEFINED,
121        embed: UndefinedOr[Embed] = UNDEFINED,
122        embeds: UndefinedOr[Sequence[Embed]] = UNDEFINED,
123        mentions_everyone: UndefinedOr[bool] = UNDEFINED,
124        user_mentions: UndefinedOr[SnowflakeishSequence[PartialUser] | bool] = UNDEFINED,
125        role_mentions: UndefinedOr[SnowflakeishSequence[PartialRole] | bool] = UNDEFINED,
126        ensure_message: bool = False,
127    ) -> Message | None:
128        if ephemeral:
129            if flags is UNDEFINED:
130                flags = MessageFlag.EPHEMERAL
131            else:
132                flags |= MessageFlag.EPHEMERAL
133
134        kwargs: dict[str, Any] = dict(
135            content=content,
136            attachment=attachment,
137            attachments=attachments,
138            component=component,
139            components=components,
140            embed=embed,
141            embeds=embeds,
142            mentions_everyone=mentions_everyone,
143            user_mentions=user_mentions,
144            role_mentions=role_mentions,
145        )
146
147        if not (self._has_deferred_response or self._has_created_message):
148            if future := self._unset_future:
149                resp = (
150                    self.interaction.build_response()
151                    .set_content(content)
152                    .set_user_mentions(user_mentions)
153                    .set_role_mentions(role_mentions)
154                    .set_mentions_everyone(mentions_everyone)
155                    .set_flags(flags)
156                    .set_tts(tts)
157                )
158                if attachments:
159                    for a in attachments:
160                        resp = resp.add_attachment(a)
161                if attachment:
162                    resp = resp.add_attachment(attachment)
163                if components:
164                    for c in components:
165                        resp = resp.add_component(c)
166                if component:
167                    resp = resp.add_component(component)
168                if embeds:
169                    for e in embeds:
170                        resp = resp.add_embed(e)
171                if embed:
172                    resp = resp.add_embed(embed)
173
174                future.set_result(resp)
175            else:
176                await self.app.rest.create_interaction_response(
177                    **kwargs,
178                    tts=tts,
179                    flags=flags,
180                    interaction=self.id,
181                    token=self.token,
182                    response_type=ResponseType.MESSAGE_CREATE,
183                )
184
185            self._has_created_message = True
186
187            if not ensure_message:
188                return None
189
190            return await self.app.rest.fetch_interaction_response(self.application_id, self.token)
191
192        if self._has_deferred_response and not self._has_created_message:
193            res = await self.edit(**kwargs)
194            self._has_created_message = True
195            return res
196
197        return await self.followup(**kwargs)
async def edit( self, content: Union[Any, hikari.undefined.UndefinedType, NoneType] = UNDEFINED, *, attachment: 'UndefinedNoneOr[Resourceish | Attachment]' = UNDEFINED, attachments: 'UndefinedNoneOr[Sequence[Resourceish | Attachment]]' = UNDEFINED, component: Union[hikari.api.special_endpoints.ComponentBuilder, hikari.undefined.UndefinedType, NoneType] = UNDEFINED, components: Union[Sequence[hikari.api.special_endpoints.ComponentBuilder], hikari.undefined.UndefinedType, NoneType] = UNDEFINED, embed: Union[hikari.embeds.Embed, hikari.undefined.UndefinedType, NoneType] = UNDEFINED, embeds: Union[Sequence[hikari.embeds.Embed], hikari.undefined.UndefinedType, NoneType] = UNDEFINED, mentions_everyone: Union[bool, hikari.undefined.UndefinedType] = UNDEFINED, user_mentions: Union[Sequence[Union[hikari.users.PartialUser, hikari.snowflakes.Snowflake, int]], bool, hikari.undefined.UndefinedType] = UNDEFINED, role_mentions: Union[Sequence[Union[hikari.guilds.PartialRole, hikari.snowflakes.Snowflake, int]], bool, hikari.undefined.UndefinedType] = UNDEFINED) -> hikari.messages.Message:

 97    async def fetch_options(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
 98        if not self.interaction.options:
 99            return {}
100
101        out: dict[str, Any] = {}
102
103        async def get_option(option: CommandInteractionOption) -> None:
104            if func := _serialization_map.get(OptionType(option.type)):
105                # `option.value` is a `Snowflake` or `int` for all option types
106                # in `_serialization_map`.
107                assert option.value
108                out[option.name] = await func(self, Snowflake(option.value))
109            else:
110                out[option.name] = option.value
111
112        await gather_iter(get_option(option) for option in self.interaction.options)
113
114        return out

def event( callback: 'CallbackT[Any] | None' = None, /, *, event_type: type[typing.Any] | None = None) -> 'Callable[[CallbackT[Any]], Includable[CallbackT[Any]]] | Includable[CallbackT[Any]]': 
33def event(
34    callback: CallbackT[Any] | None = None, /, *, event_type: type[Any] | None = None
35) -> Callable[[CallbackT[Any]], Includable[CallbackT[Any]]] | Includable[CallbackT[Any]]:
36    if callback is None:
37        return partial(event, event_type=event_type)
38
39    if not event_type:
40        event_type = next(iter(get_type_hints(callback).values()))
41
42    if not event_type:
43        raise ValueError("`event_type` must be provided in the decorator or as a typehint")
44
45    if not iscoroutinefunction(callback):
46        raise ValueError(f"`{callback.__name__}` must be an async function.")
47
48    def hook(includable: Includable[CallbackT[Any]]) -> None:
49        if isinstance(includable.client.app, GatewayTraits):
50            includable.client.app.event_manager.subscribe(
51                event_type=unwrap(event_type), callback=event_callback
52            )
53        else:
54            raise ValueError("Events can only be used with GatewayBot.")
55
56    def on_remove(includable: Includable[CallbackT[Any]]) -> None:
57        # if it's not `GatewayTraits`, the event could never have been
58        # added in the first place.
59        assert isinstance(includable.client.app, GatewayTraits)
60        includable.client.app.event_manager.unsubscribe(
61            event_type=unwrap(event_type), callback=event_callback
62        )
63
64    includable = Includable(
65        metadata=callback, client_set_hooks=[hook], plugin_unload_hooks=[on_remove]
66    )
67    event_callback = _event_callback(includable)
68
69    return includable

class ClassCommandProto(typing.Protocol): 
65class ClassCommandProto(Protocol):
66    async def callback(self, ctx: Any) -> Any:
67        ...

Base class for protocol classes.

Protocol classes are defined as::

class Proto(Protocol):
    def meth(self) -> int:
        ...

Such classes are primarily used with static type checkers that recognize structural subtyping (static duck-typing), for example::

class C:
    def meth(self) -> int:
        return 0

def func(x: Proto) -> int:
    return x.meth()

func(C())  # Passes static type check

See PEP 544 for details. Protocol classes decorated with @typing.runtime_checkable act as simple-minded runtime protocols that check only the presence of given attributes, ignoring their type signatures. Protocol classes can be generic, they are defined as::

class GenProto(Protocol[T]):
    def meth(self) -> T:
        ...
ClassCommandProto(*args, **kwargs) 
1431def _no_init_or_replace_init(self, *args, **kwargs):
1432    cls = type(self)
1433
1434    if cls._is_protocol:
1435        raise TypeError('Protocols cannot be instantiated')
1436
1437    # Already using a custom `__init__`. No need to calculate correct
1438    # `__init__` to call. This can lead to RecursionError. See bpo-45121.
1439    if cls.__init__ is not _no_init_or_replace_init:
1440        return
1441
1442    # Initially, `__init__` of a protocol subclass is set to `_no_init_or_replace_init`.
1443    # The first instantiation of the subclass will call `_no_init_or_replace_init` which
1444    # searches for a proper new `__init__` in the MRO. The new `__init__`
1445    # replaces the subclass' old `__init__` (ie `_no_init_or_replace_init`). Subsequent
1446    # instantiation of the protocol subclass will thus use the new
1447    # `__init__` and no longer call `_no_init_or_replace_init`.
1448    for base in cls.__mro__:
1449        init = base.__dict__.get('__init__', _no_init_or_replace_init)
1450        if init is not _no_init_or_replace_init:
1451            cls.__init__ = init
1452            break
1453    else:
1454        # should not happen
1455        cls.__init__ = object.__init__
1456
1457    cls.__init__(self, *args, **kwargs)
async def callback(self, ctx: Any) -> Any: 
66    async def callback(self, ctx: Any) -> Any:
67        ...
class Plugin(typing.Generic[~BotT, ~ModelT]): 
182class Plugin(Generic[BotT, ModelT]):
183    def __init__(
184        self,
185        *,
186        command_hooks: list[HookCallbackT] | None = None,
187        command_after_hooks: list[HookCallbackT] | None = None,
188    ) -> None:
189        self.command_hooks = command_hooks
190        self.command_after_hooks = command_after_hooks
191        self._client: Client | None = None
192        self._model: ModelT | None = None
193        self._children: list[Includable[Any]] = []
194
195        self._load_hooks: list[PluginCallbackT] = []
196        self._unload_hooks: list[PluginCallbackT] = []
197
198    def include(self, obj: T) -> T:
199        add_hooks(self, obj)
200        self._children.append(obj)
201        return obj
202
203    def load_hook(self, callback: PluginCallbackT) -> None:
204        self._load_hooks.append(callback)
205
206    def unload_hook(self, callback: PluginCallbackT) -> None:
207        self._unload_hooks.append(callback)
208
209    @property
210    def app(self) -> BotT:
211        if not self._client:
212            raise AttributeError("`Plugin.app` can not be accessed before the plugin is loaded.")
213        return cast(BotT, self._client.app)
214
215    @property
216    def model(self) -> ModelT:
217        if not self._client:
218            raise AttributeError("`Plugin.model` can not be accessed before the plugin is loaded.")
219        return cast(ModelT, self._client.model)
220
221    @property
222    def client(self) -> Client:
223        if not self._client:
224            raise AttributeError(
225                "`Plugin.client` can not be accessed before the plugin is loaded."
226            )
227        return self._client
228
229    def _load(self, client: Client) -> None:
230        self._client = client
231
232        for callback in self._load_hooks:
233            callback()
234        for child in self._children:
235            add_hooks(client, child)
236            child.register_to_client(client)
237
238    def _unload(self) -> None:
239        for callback in self._unload_hooks:
240            callback()
241
242        for child in self._children:
243            for hook in child.plugin_unload_hooks:
244                hook(child)
245
246        self._client = None
247
248    @overload
249    @classmethod
250    def _from_module(cls, path: str, /, *, refresh: bool = ...) -> Plugin[BotT, ModelT]:
251        ...
252
253    @overload
254    @classmethod
255    def _from_module(
256        cls, path: str, *, strict: Literal[True], refresh: bool = ...
257    ) -> Plugin[BotT, ModelT]:
258        ...
259
260    @overload
261    @classmethod
262    def _from_module(
263        cls, path: str, *, strict: Literal[False], refresh: bool = ...
264    ) -> Plugin[BotT, ModelT] | None:
265        ...
266
267    @overload
268    @classmethod
269    def _from_module(
270        cls, path: str, refresh: bool = ..., strict: bool = ...
271    ) -> Plugin[BotT, ModelT] | None:
272        ...
273
274    @classmethod
275    def _from_module(
276        cls, path: str, refresh: bool = False, strict: bool = True
277    ) -> Plugin[BotT, ModelT] | None:
278        parents = path.split(".")
279
280        name = parents.pop(-1)
281        package = ".".join(parents)
282        if package:
283            name = "." + name
284        module = import_module(name, package)
285        if refresh:
286            module = reload(module)
287        plugin: Plugin[BotT, ModelT] | None = getattr(module, "plugin", None)
288        if strict and not plugin:
289            raise ValueError(
290                f"Plugin {path} has no `plugin` or `plugin` is not of type Plugin. "
291                "If you want to name your plugin something else, you have to add an "
292                "alias (plugin = YOUR_PLUGIN_NAME)."
293            )
294
295        return plugin

Abstract base class for generic types.

A generic type is typically declared by inheriting from this class parameterized with one or more type variables. For example, a generic mapping type might be defined as::

class Mapping(Generic[KT, VT]): def __getitem__(self, key: KT) -> VT: ... # Etc.

This class can then be used as follows::

def lookup_name(mapping: Mapping[KT, VT], key: KT, default: VT) -> VT: try: return mapping[key] except KeyError: return default

Plugin( *, command_hooks: list[typing.Callable[[typing.Any], typing.Awaitable[typing.Optional[crescent.HookResult]]]] | None = None, command_after_hooks: list[typing.Callable[[typing.Any], typing.Awaitable[typing.Optional[crescent.HookResult]]]] | None = None)

185        *,

187        command_after_hooks: list[HookCallbackT] | None = None,
188    ) -> None:
189        self.command_hooks = command_hooks
190        self.command_after_hooks = command_after_hooks
191        self._client: Client | None = None
192        self._model: ModelT | None = None
193        self._children: list[Includable[Any]] = []
194
195        self._load_hooks: list[PluginCallbackT] = []
196        self._unload_hooks: list[PluginCallbackT] = []
def include(self, obj: ~T) -> ~T: 
198    def include(self, obj: T) -> T:
199        add_hooks(self, obj)
200        self._children.append(obj)
201        return obj
def load_hook(self, callback: Callable[[], NoneType]) -> None: 
203    def load_hook(self, callback: PluginCallbackT) -> None:
204        self._load_hooks.append(callback)
def unload_hook(self, callback: Callable[[], NoneType]) -> None:

class PluginManager: 
 31class PluginManager:
 32    def __init__(self, client: Client) -> None:
 33        self.plugins: dict[str, Plugin[Any, Any]] = {}
 34        self._client = client
 35
 36    @overload
 37    def load(self, path: str, /, *, refresh: bool = ...) -> Plugin[Any, Any]:
 38        ...
 39
 40    @overload
 41    def load(self, path: str, *, strict: Literal[True], refresh: bool = ...) -> Plugin[Any, Any]:
 42        ...
 43
 44    @overload
 45    def load(
 46        self, path: str, *, strict: Literal[False], refresh: bool = ...
 47    ) -> Plugin[Any, Any] | None:
 48        ...
 49
 50    @overload
 51    def load(self, path: str, refresh: bool = ..., strict: bool = ...) -> Plugin[Any, Any] | None:
 52        ...
 53
 54    def load(
 55        self, path: str, refresh: bool = False, strict: bool = True
 56    ) -> Plugin[Any, Any] | None:
 57        """Load a plugin from the module path.
 58
 59        ```python
 60        import crescent
 61
 62        bot = crescent.Bot(token=...)
 63
 64        bot.plugins.load("folder.plugin")
 65        ```
 66
 67        Args:
 68            path: The module path for the plugin.
 69            refresh: Whether or not to reload the plugin and the plugin's module.
 70            strict:
 71                If false, the function will not error when module file does not have a plugin
 72                variable.
 73        """
 74
 75        if refresh:
 76            old_plugin = self.plugins.pop(path)
 77            old_plugin._unload()
 78
 79        plugin: Plugin[Any, Any] | None = Plugin._from_module(path, refresh=refresh, strict=strict)
 80        if not plugin:
 81            return None
 82        self._add_plugin(path, plugin, refresh=refresh)
 83
 84        return plugin
 85
 86    def load_folder(
 87        self, path: str, refresh: bool = False, strict: bool = True
 88    ) -> list[Plugin[Any, Any]]:
 89        """Loads plugins from a folder.
 90
 91        ```python
 92        import crescent
 93        import hikari
 94
 95        bot = hikari.GatewayBot(token=...)
 96        client = crescent.Client(bot)
 97
 98        client.plugins.load("project.plugin_folder")
 99        ```
100
101        If a file is attempted to be loaded that does not have a plugin variable,
102        a `ValueError` will be raised. Files who's names start with an underscore
103        will not be loaded.
104
105        Args:
106            path: The path to the folder that contains the plugins.
107            refresh: Whether or not to reload the plugin and the plugin's module.
108            strict:
109                If false, the function will not error when a file does not have a plugin
110                variable.
111        Returns:
112            A list of plugins that were loaded.
113        """
114
115        pathlib_path = Path(*path.split("."))
116        loaded_plugins: list[Plugin[Any, Any]] = []
117        loaded_paths: list[str] = []
118
119        for glob_path in pathlib_path.glob(r"**/[!_]*.py"):
120            self._load_plugin_from_filepath(
121                path=glob_path,
122                plugins=loaded_plugins,
123                paths=loaded_paths,
124                refresh=refresh,
125                strict=strict,
126            )
127
128        if not loaded_plugins:
129            _LOG.warning(
130                "No plugins were loaded! Are you sure `%s` is the correct directory?", pathlib_path
131            )
132
133        return loaded_plugins
134
135    def _load_plugin_from_filepath(
136        self,
137        path: Path,
138        plugins: list[Plugin[Any, Any]],
139        paths: list[str],
140        *,
141        strict: bool,
142        refresh: bool,
143    ) -> None:
144        mod_name = ".".join(path.as_posix()[:-3].split("/"))
145        try:
146            if maybe_plugin := self.load(mod_name, refresh=refresh, strict=strict):
147                plugins.append(maybe_plugin)
148                paths.append(mod_name)
149        except ValueError as e:
150            for plugin_path in paths:
151                self.unload(plugin_path)
152            raise e
153
154    def _add_plugin(self, path: str, plugin: Plugin[Any, Any], refresh: bool = False) -> None:
155        if path in self.plugins and not refresh:
156            raise PluginAlreadyLoadedError(
157                f"Plugin `{path}` is already loaded."
158                " Add the kwarg `refresh=True` to the function call if this is intended."
159            )
160
161        self.plugins[path] = plugin
162        plugin._load(self._client)
163
164    def unload(self, path: str) -> None:
165        """
166        Unload a plugin.
167
168        Args:
169            path: The module path for the plugin.
170        """
171        plugin = self.plugins.pop(path)
172        plugin._unload()
173
174    def unload_all(self) -> None:
175        """
176        Unload all of the plugins that are currently loaded.
177        """
178        for path in tuple(self.plugins.keys()):
179            self.unload(path)
PluginManager(client: crescent.Client) 
32    def __init__(self, client: Client) -> None:
33        self.plugins: dict[str, Plugin[Any, Any]] = {}
34        self._client = client

74
75        if refresh:

106    def _gen_option(self, name: str) -> CommandOption:
107        name, name_localizations = str_or_build_locale(self.name or name)
108        description, description_localizations = str_or_build_locale(self.description)
